description: Scenario language MUST use domain concept terminology. Given/When/Then steps should reference domain entities and concepts, not UI elements or technical implementation details.

do.description: Use domain language in scenario steps - reference domain concepts by name.

guidance.description: Reference domain concepts in Given steps (state, not actions)
example: DOMAIN MODEL:
Enterprise (enterprise_id, name)
└── User (user_id, name, role)
└── Recipient (recipient_id, name, bank_info)
Given an Enterprise with active Recipients
And a User with wire payment permissions

guidance.description: Reference domain concepts in When steps (domain actions)
example: When the User selects a Recipient
And enters the PaymentAmount

guidance.description: Reference domain concepts in Then steps (domain outcomes)
example: Then the WirePayment is created with status pending
And the Recipient receives notification

dont.description: Don't use UI element names, technical implementation terms, or generic words instead of domain concepts.

guidance.description: Don't use UI/technical terms in Given steps
example: Given the recipient list page is loaded
Given the user has clicked the wire button
Given the dropdown shows recipients

guidance.description: Don't use UI actions on UI elements in When steps
example: When the user clicks the dropdown
And types in the input field
When user clicks the table row

guidance.description: Don't use UI verification in Then steps
example: Then the success message is displayed
And the green checkmark appears
Then the modal displays account info

guidance.description: Don't use generic terms when domain concepts exist
example: Given the user has items
When they select an item
Then the thing is processed
